column2: The fast-moving storm Elsa lashed New York City and New England with heavy rain and high winds on Friday, flooding streets, toppling trees and turning the subway into a water fountain.</

column1: Lockdown tightens for NSW as restrictions ease elsewhere
column2: Millions around Australia have been thrust into lockdown as states and territories battle a nationwide COVID-19 outbreak.</

column1: Previously announced exposure sites upgraded from casual to close contacts
column2: Patrons of Coles Kareela and KFC Rockdale were originally dubbed casual contacts but are now being reclassified as close contacts of a confirmed case</

column1: Domestic flight announced as an exposure site
column2: Victoria's Department of Health has contacted passengers on a recent Launceston to Melbourne flight that included a passenger who has since tested positive for COVID-19 in London.</

column1: Murder charges after human remains found in search for missing man
column2: Murder charges have been laid over the suspicious disappearance of Brendon Farrell after human remains were found in a Melbourne home.</

column1: Barty's Wimbledon triumph
column2: A tearful Ash Barty has become the first Australian woman to win the singles trophy at the All England Club since Evonne Goolagong Cawley in 1980, defeating Karolina Pliskova in a thrilling final.</

column1: Victoria slams border shut for NSW, ACT
column2: Victoria is closing its borders to NSW and the ACT from 11.59pm tonight, with the entire region becoming a "red zone".</

column1: Elderly Sydney woman dies of COVID-19 hours after testing positive
column2: An elderly woman has died in a Sydney hospital just hours after testing positive to COVID-19.</

column1: Dog to be put down after five-week-old killed on NSW Central Coast
column2: A five-week-old baby boy has died after being mauled by his family's dog in the middle of the night on the NSW Central Coast.</

column1: Queensland records zero new cases
column2: Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk announced that the state had detected just one new case in an overseas traveller who is currently in hotel quarantine.</

column1: US records fourth day of 20,000 new COVID cases due to Delta variant
column2: The US has surpassed 20,000 new COVID-19 cases for the fourth day in a row as the Delta variant persists in its track in being the most common form of the coronavirus in the country.</

column1: 'Bursting with pride': PM reacts to Ash Barty's historic win
column2: Prime Minister Scott Morrison has taken to social media to pay tribute to newly crowned  Wimbledon champion Ash Barty, saying "Australia is bursting with pride". </

column1: 'We need to be much firmer': NSW police to crack down even further
column2: Police across the state will start cracking down even harder on people caught breaking lockdown restrictions after another 106 fines were handed down in the last day. </

column1: 'Meant to be graphic': New ad shows impact of COVID-19
column2: A young woman struggling to breathe in her hospital bed is the focus of a new advertisement campaign urging people to get vaccinated for COVID-19.</

column1: Health authorities concerned over tradies working at multiple sites
column2: Health authorities are concerned about COVID-19 transmission among the state's tradespeople, particularly those who work on multiple sites. </

column1: 'Much worse' to come as NSW records 77 new infections
column2: Premier Gladys Berejiklian says she'll "be shocked" if tomorrow's figures are less than 100 as contact tracers struggle to keep pace.</

column1: Calls for teachers to get jab priority as schools face 'tinderbox situation'
column2: There are growing calls for teachers to be given priority access to COVID-19 vaccinations amid concerns the Delta variant could create a "tinderbox situation" within schools.</

column1: Olympics venues left to rot after the glory's gone
column2: With the delayed Tokyo 2020 Summer Olympics less than a fortnight away, take a look at what's happened to venues left abandoned and derelict in other countries after the medals were awarded and the visitors departed.</

column1: US on track to withdraw troops from Afghanistan
column2: President Joe Biden delivered a vehement defense Thursday of his decision to end the war in Afghanistan, insisting no amount of sustained American presence there could resolve the country's own intractable problems.</

column1: NT residents in NSW told 'come home now'
column2: Millions around Australia have been thrust into lockdown as states and territories battle a nationwide COVID-19 outbreak.</

column1: Billionaire Richard Branson blasts his way into space
column2: Richard Branson became the first person to ride into space aboard a rocket he helped fund. </

column1: China, North Korea vow closer ties as 'hostile forces become more desperate'
column2: et="" rel="">North Korean and Chinese leaders have expressed their desire to further strengthen their ties while exchanging messages marking the 60th anniversary of their countries' defence treaty

column1: Man charged with murder after woman's body found in South Australia
column2: A man has been charged with murder over the death of a woman in Mount Gambier, South Australia.</

column1: The last of WA's post-lockdown restrictions have lifted
column2: The Perth and Peel regions have returned to normal after the lifting of the last post-lockdown restrictions.</

column1: Perth braces for fifth monster storm in eight days
column2: Perth is bracing for yet another monster storm, while frantically trying to repair the damage from Friday's weather event.</
